body_html:
Hi! I have this issue to.

I am using Ubuntu 16.04, with Python 3.5.1, TensorFlow master (currently at 4a4f246) and Bazel master (Build label: 0.2.2b-2016-05-09 (@7222943)).

Here are my steps to reproduce:

  1. Install gcc-4.9 and g++-4.9
  2. export CXX=/usr/bin/g++-4.9 and export CC=/usr/bin/gcc-4.9
  3. Change to bazel directory, run ./compile
  4. Copy bazel/output/bazel to ~/.bazel/bazel, symlink ~/bin/bazel -> ~/.bazel/bazel
  5. Add cxx_flag: "-D_FORCE_INLINES" to tensorflow/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL at line 52
  6. Run bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --genrule_strategy=standalone --local_resources 4096,4.0,1.0 -j 4 //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
  7. Run bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --genrule_strategy=standalone --local_resources 4096,4.0,1.0 -j 4 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
  8. Observe that the bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/__main__/ directory contains tensorflow and external (and some other stuff) that should probably be in bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/

Running

cp -r bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/__main__/* bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/

works around this issue. (Thanks to @ZhuFengdaaa for this!)

@vrv Please reopen the issue and don't hesitate to ask for more information :)

I am using Ubuntu 16.04, with Python 3.5.1, TensorFlow master (currently at  4a4f246) and Bazel master (Build label: 0.2.2b-2016-05-09 (@7222943)).

Run bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --genrule_strategy=standalone --local_resources 4096,4.0,1.0 -j 4 //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer
Run bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --genrule_strategy=standalone --local_resources 4096,4.0,1.0 -j 4 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
Observe that the bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/__main__/ directory contains tensorflow and external (and some other stuff) that should probably be in bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/

body:
Hi! I have this issue to.

I am using Ubuntu 16.04, with Python 3.5.1, TensorFlow master (currently at  4a4f2461533847dde239851ecebe5056088a828c) and Bazel master (`Build label: 0.2.2b-2016-05-09 (@7222943)`).

Here are my steps to reproduce:
1. Install gcc-4.9 and g++-4.9
2. export CXX=/usr/bin/g++-4.9 and export CC=/usr/bin/gcc-4.9
3. Change to bazel directory, run ./compile
4. Copy  bazel/output/bazel to ~/.bazel/bazel, symlink ~/bin/bazel -> ~/.bazel/bazel
5. Add `cxx_flag: "-D_FORCE_INLINES"` to tensorflow/third_party/gpus/crosstool/CROSSTOOL at line 52
6. Run `bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --genrule_strategy=standalone --local_resources 4096,4.0,1.0 -j 4 //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer`
7. Run `bazel build -c opt --config=cuda --genrule_strategy=standalone --local_resources 4096,4.0,1.0 -j 4 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package`
8. Observe that the `bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/__main__/` directory contains `tensorflow` and `external` (and some other stuff) that should probably be in `bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/`

Running

```
cp -r bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/__main__/* bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/
```

works around this issue. (Thanks to @ZhuFengdaaa for this!)

@vrv Please reopen the issue and don't hesitate to ask for more information :)
